history.content:
1. I do not think so. I had a similar schedule this semester (with CS170 in lieu of 61C) and did well, in spite of having extracurricular commitments. I disagree with the rumor about 186 - the projects seem to be harder this semester (they have been revamped and now require significant coding aptitude) but if you are comfortable in Java/did well in CS61B, it shouldn't be too difficult tbh. Exams were definitely similar in difficulty to previous semesters.

2. Not "significantly", but yes, 186 projects do take more time in general than 188's fill-in-the-code projects. 188 has harder exams though so you might need to spend more time (than 186) studying the material and preparing for the tests.

I'd personally advise you to go ahead with schedule 1. It is going to be a challenging semester though so make sure you're up for it!

I'd personally advise you to go ahead with schedule 1. It is going to be a challenging semester though so make sure you're up for it!

children.subject: OP here. Thanks for your advice!

+1 on schedule 1. Despite not having a ton of overlap, I think 186 and DS100 kinda complement each other, and. are good to take together in the same semester. 186 is also most internship oriented of the 3 combos
OP here. 61c not necessary for 186 according to many TAs. Also, taking 61c before 186 apparently gives little to no advantage for 186.

61C isn't all that important; there are like 1-2 lectures where the professor cites material taught in 61C but that's very basic and you can live through the class even without knowing them.

61B, on the other hand, is absolutely essential, in my opinion. The course is heavily dependent on Java programming and its nuances, which is covered in 61B. Moreover, the presence of large-scale projects in 61B gives you vital experience building large segments of systems, without which, it'd be quite impossible to complete the 186 projects (unless you have gained that kind of experience as part of your programming background).

tl;dr Just 61A is definitely not enough..
Is 61b all that is required for taking 186? I thought that 61c was important for it.

history.content:
Background: I'll be recruiting for an internship, studying for interviews, attending hackathons, and working on a project.

1. Will my first schedule be too much to handle, given my extra curricular activities? I've heard 186 has gotten significantly more difficult since last semester.

2. Is 186 significantly more time consuming than 188? I prefer learning 186 material over 188 material next semester.

3. Has anyone taken info 190/234? Hows the workload? Worthwhile course? My 3rd schedule will most likely be the easiest of the 3.
history.subject: Workload Comparisons? (61c,100c,186) vs (61c, 100c, 188) vs (61c, 100c, info 190/234)
